intro: Satyria minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered satyria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many species of violets and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or violet. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Satyria minutiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
